commitResults.messageTitle: minimum requirements for first task without the lines
edited unnecessary comments from the program and added the lines

commitResults.messageBody:
The Duke symbol was removed from the code.
This symbol was used to test out the code when it was cloned from
a remote directory.

Two statements and a few lines were added.These act as a base
for future communications.

This the is required task for week 2.

Chatbot echo's user's commands and exits when
the user types "bye".

Function printLines prints dotted lines. This improves
 code readability.

Users would be able to enter their name and Chatbot
records it. Addresses the user with the name
given.

Chatbot prompts user to add in tasks
and displays it to the user when the command
"list" is used.

Class Task keeps track of the
String array that stores all the tasks. The
class contains the relevant constructors, getters
and setters for the class.

Function addTask in Task.java adds the task
to the array and function printTasks prints the existing
tasks if user enters the command "list".

Initialise function in Duke .java prompts
user to enter name

The chatbot is able to update the completion statuses of the tasks that
were given by the user. The command "done " prompts the system to
change the completion status of the task as completed.

In the Task Class, the completion array stores the completion statuses of the tasks. The
completeTasks function controls the completion statuses
of the tasks.The appropriate getters and setters have been added for this class
level member

The printTasks function now accommodates the printing of
the tick and cross symbols for the task.

In the Duke Class, the commands function reads the input of the users
and decides the appropriate course of action.

Function command () causes confusion to readers.
Hence, it is changed to readInput to comply with the Coding
Standards.

Implentation of the task class as an array of objects
makes it harder for the tasks to be modified in the future. Hence, the class
now initialises single task objects. The array is then initialised
in the main function.

The functions in the Task class now modify the specific
task it is called upon to modify.

Classes Todo,Deadline and Event were created to
track the different types of tasks that are available. There
classes inherit from the Task class.

Funciton toString has been defined in all of the classes
(except Duke class) .The function returns the string representation
of the class. Furthermore, this function overrides the original
toString function in Object class.

The seperate task classes(Todo,Deadline and Event) each have overridden
 toString methods,which add on the specific character of the type of  task
to be printed out.

Main file able to read inputs from the input.txt
file and pass the outputs to the ACTUAL.txt file.
After that, the ACTUAL.txt file is compared with the
EXPECTED.txt file to examine any differences.

Runtest.bat file modified so that the EXPECTED.txt
now displays the unicode characters. Previously,
it only displayed question marks.
